to help you better understand the “try {” method.

 } catch (Exception e) {

is an example of a catch exception

heres my code:

[code=java]if (cmd.StartsWith(“kill”) && playerRights >= 1) {
try {
String otherPName = command.substring(6);
int otherPIndex = PlayerManager.getPlayerID(otherPName);

                if (otherPIndex != -1) {
                    client p = (client) Server.PlayerManager.Players[otherPIndex];
					c.lowGFX(78,0);
					c.lowGFX(451,0);
                    c.playerkilled = 1;
                    c.Send("You have been killed by the awesome power of" + playerName);
		sM("You have killed "+c.playerName+"");
		yell(c.otherPlayerName+" has been killed by "+ c.playerName);
		                  } else { 
                   Send("The name doesnt exist."); 
                }
            } catch (Exception e) { [/code]

item.title: [317] Making a "::kill" command [317]
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

[quote=“dragx55, post:2, topic:353749”]Add an “;” on the end of int p = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name)
And try deleting “try {” and the extra “}” at the end of the code.
Should look like this:

if (command.startsWith("kill") && playerRights >= 3) { String name = command.substring(4); int p = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name); client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[p]; c.sM("You have just been struck down by King 123"); c.lowGFX(1621, 0); c.appendHit(255, 0); c.updateRequired = true; c.appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }

Also, you should try reading the what the compiler tells you sometime. You have to have “} catch (exception-classname variable-name)” when you have “try {”.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Making a "::kill" command [317]
item.dc:creator: @dragx55 dragx55
item.description:
@dragx55 wrote:

Add an “;” on the end of int p = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name)
And try deleting “try {” and the extra “}” at the end of the code.
Should look like this:

if (command.startsWith("kill") && playerRights >= 3) { String name = command.substring(4); int p = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name); client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[p]; c.sM("You have just been struck down by King 123"); c.lowGFX(1621, 0); c.appendHit(255, 0); c.updateRequired = true; c.appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }

Also, you should try reading the what the compiler tells you sometime. You have to have “} catch (exception-classname variable-name)” when you have “try {”.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Making a "::kill" command [317]
item.dc:creator: @tikistand5525 tikistand5525
item.description:
@tikistand5525 wrote:

I was wondering on how to script a kill command so that I can kill an individual player.
Here is what I’ve got so far.

if (command.startsWith("kill") && playerRights >= 3) {
String name = command.substring(4);
try {
int p = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name)
client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[p];
c.sM("You have just been struck down by King 123");
c.lowGFX(1621, 0);
c.appendHit(255, 0);
c.updateRequired = true;
c.appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}
}

Then I always get the same error:

client.java:8667: ‘;’ expected
int p = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name)
^
client.java:8666: ‘try’ without ‘catch’ or ‘finally’
try {
^
2 errors…

Any way to fix this? I tried without ‘try’ and switched words around but nothing worked…

Thanks in advance for your help!

Read full topic
